parts.value: Matrix mechanics, discovered by Werner Heisenberg and developed by him, Max Born and Pascual Jordan, is the first consistent formulation of quantum mechanics. Its discovery happened when Heisenberg imposed a multiplication rule involving the dynamical quantities of a quantum system for the sake of consistency in form. This multiplication rule was shortly after identified by Born as the multiplication rule of matrices, which then suggested that the quantities should be represented in the quantum theory by these. Eventually the most fruitful observation in this context was that two quantities
generally do not commute, i.e. the products
are generally not equal. This eventually paved the way for a general method of quantization of classical systems to be formulated, based on the
